intro: Jacobinia californica, commonly known as the California jacobinia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. It has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Jacobinia californica is a perennial shrub that blooms in late spring to early summer.
